name: Asemeia aguiariana
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364421X16128061711269 Named in honour of the plant anatomist and Polygalaceae specialist Dr. Ana Cristina Andrade de Aguiar Dias.

name: Asemeia campestris
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364421X16128061711269 The species occurs in open areas of savanna and the name is in reference to this grassland habitat.

name: Asemeia coracoralinae
remarks: doi:10.1007/s12225-023-10082-3 Etymology: the specific epithet honours the Brazilian poetess Cora Coralina, who was born in the city of Goiás (Velho), the type locality of this species.

name: Asemeia eglandulosa
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364421X16128061711269 The epithet refers to the absence of glands on the margin of the external sepals, a common feature in other species of Asemeia.

name: Asemeia minensis
distribution: Minas Gerais (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)

name: Asemeia nana
distribution: Goiás (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America);Brasília Distrito Federal (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America);
remarks: doi:10.1007/s12225-023-10082-3 Etymology: the specific epithet refers to the small size of the plants.

name: Asemeia subaphylla
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364421X16128061711269 The epithet refers to the deciduous small leaves, so that the plant is leafless at flowering.

name: Bredemeyera atlantica

name: Bredemeyera ericifolia
